001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.squidai.astar.DefaultGraph;
004import squidpony.squidai.astar.Heuristic;
005import squidpony.squidai.astar.Pathfinder;
006
007import java.io.Serializable;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Map;
010
011/**
012 * Performs A* search.
013 *
014 * A* is a best-first search algorithm for pathfinding. It uses a heuristic
015 * value to reduce the total search space. If the heuristic is too large then
016 * the optimal path is not guaranteed to be returned.
017 * <br>
018 * This implementation is a thin wrapper around {@link Pathfinder} and the other code in the
019 * {@code squidpony.squidai.astar} package; it replaces an older, much-less-efficient A* implementation with one based
020 * on GDX-AI's IndexedAStarPathFinder class. The only major change in the API is that this version returns an ArrayList
021 * of Coord instead of a Queue of Coord. Typical usage of this class involves
022 * {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][], Map, double)} to generate the cost
023 * map; if you used the old AStarSearch, then be advised that the default cost is now 1.0 instead of 0.0.
024 * @see squidpony.squidai.astar.Pathfinder the pathfinding class this is based on; Pathfinder can be used independently
025 * @see squidpony.squidai.DijkstraMap a sometimes-faster pathfinding algorithm that can pathfind to multiple goals
026 * @see squidpony.squidai.CustomDijkstraMap an alternative to DijkstraMap; faster and supports complex adjacency rules
027 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
028 * @author Tommy Ettinger - optimized code
029 */
030public class AStarSearch implements Serializable {
031    private static final long serialVersionUID = 10L;
032    /**
033     * The type of heuristic to use.
034     */
035    public enum SearchType {
036
037        /**
038         * The distance it takes when only the four primary directions can be
039         * moved in.
040         */
041        MANHATTAN(DefaultGraph.MANHATTAN),
042        /**
043         * The distance it takes when diagonal movement costs the same as
044         * cardinal movement.
045         */
046        CHEBYSHEV(DefaultGraph.CHEBYSHEV),
047        /**
048         * The distance it takes as the crow flies.
049         */
050        EUCLIDEAN(DefaultGraph.EUCLIDEAN),
051        /**
052         * Full space search. Least efficient but guaranteed to return a path if
053         * one exists. See also DijkstraMap class.
054         */
055        DIJKSTRA(DefaultGraph.DIJKSTRA);
056        Heuristic<Coord> heuristic;
057        SearchType(Heuristic<Coord> heuristic){
058            this.heuristic = heuristic;
059        }
060    }
061
062    protected final int width, height;
063    protected Coord start, target;
064    protected final SearchType type;
065    
066    protected DefaultGraph graph;
067    protected Pathfinder<Coord> pathfinder;
068    protected ArrayList<Coord> path;
069    
070    
071    protected AStarSearch()
072    {
073        width = 0;
074        height = 0;
075        type = SearchType.MANHATTAN;
076    }
077    /**
078     * Builds a pathing object to run searches on.
079     *
080     * Values in the map are treated as positive values (and 0) being legal
081     * weights, with higher values being harder to pass through. Any negative
082     * value is treated as being an impassible space.
083     *
084     * If the type is Manhattan, only the cardinal directions will be used. All
085     * other search types will return results based on intercardinal and
086     * cardinal pathing.
087     *
088     * @param map
089     *            the search map. It is not modified by this class, hence you can
090     *            share this map among multiple instances.
091     * @param type the manner of search
092     */
093    public AStarSearch(double[][] map, SearchType type) {
094        if (map == null)
095            throw new NullPointerException("map should not be null when building an AStarSearch");
096        width = map.length;
097        height = width == 0 ? 0 : map[0].length;
098        this.type = type == null ? SearchType.DIJKSTRA : type;         
099        graph = new DefaultGraph(map, (this.type != SearchType.MANHATTAN));
100        pathfinder = new Pathfinder<>(graph, true);
101        path = new ArrayList<>(width + height);
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * Finds an A* path to the target from the start. If no path is possible,
106     * returns null.
107     *
108     * @param startx the x coordinate of the start location
109     * @param starty the y coordinate of the start location
110     * @param targetx the x coordinate of the target location
111     * @param targety the y coordinate of the target location
112     * @return the shortest path, or null if no path is possible
113     */
114    public ArrayList<Coord> path(int startx, int starty, int targetx, int targety) {
115        return path(Coord.get(startx, starty), Coord.get(targetx, targety));
116    }
117    /**
118     * Finds an A* path to the target from the start. If no path is possible,
119     * returns null.
120     *
121     * @param start the start location
122     * @param target the target location
123     * @return the shortest path, or null if no path is possible
124     */
125    public ArrayList<Coord> path(Coord start, Coord target) {
126        path.clear();
127        this.start = start;
128        this.target = target;
129        if(pathfinder.searchNodePath(start, target, type.heuristic, path)) 
130            return path;
131        else
132            return null;
133    }
134
135        public int getWidth() {
136                return width;
137        }
138
139        public int getHeight() {
140                return height;
141        }
142
143        @Override
144        public String toString() {
145        int cellSize = (int)Math.log10(Math.round(pathfinder.metrics.maxCost)) + 2;
146        StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder((width * cellSize + 1) * height);
147        graph.show(result, pathfinder, pathfinder.metrics);
148        for (int i = 0; i + 1 < cellSize; i++) {
149            result.setCharAt((width * cellSize + 1) * start.y + cellSize * start.x + i, '@');
150            result.setCharAt((width * cellSize + 1) * target.y + cellSize * target.x + i, '!');
151        }
152        return result.toString();
153    }
154    /*
155    public static final int DIMENSION = 40, PATH_LENGTH = (DIMENSION - 2) * (DIMENSION - 2);
156    public static DungeonGenerator dungeonGen =
157            new DungeonGenerator(DIMENSION, DIMENSION, new StatefulRNG(0x1337BEEFDEAL));

174    public static long doPathAStar2()
175    {
176        AStarSearch astar = new AStarSearch(astarMap, AStarSearch.SearchType.CHEBYSHEV);
177        Coord r;
178        long scanned = 0;
179        DungeonUtility utility = new DungeonUtility(new StatefulRNG(new LightRNG(0x1337BEEFDEAL)));

181        for (int x = 1; x < DIMENSION - 1; x++) {

194    */
195}
